channel.title: Market Research 2011
channel.description:
I've almost decided I might consider wanting to do something productive this year, so help me out.
It's simple, just name an application (web or otherwise) that you use frequently, then list some grievances you have with the application. Sort of like a software festivus.
No moparscape allowed.

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

VNC is usually pretty slow for me. TeamViewer is faster and also keeps the screen looking (very much) like the original screen, where VNC compresses the shit out of it, loses quality, and is still slower. VNC has never worked well for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

why not just use vnc??

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

For Windows it’s super weird. With Linux you can just ln folders into the Dropbox folder.

But since I also have Dropbox on my Windows partitions, I had to figure out a way. I don’t think it’s as easy as moving the folder there, and then shortcutting it to another place. But there is a plugin for it somewhere on the site.

And the Teamviewer program.

I use it across all my machines (in each of their OSs). However, not in the way intended so there’s usually not another person sitting at the machine to tell me the password.

I would LOVE to be able to ssh in to the machine, start Teamviewer via terminal, and have it output the ID and password there and start Teamviewer. Currently it starts Teamviewer like normal. So I have to start it, open a ssh tunnel for my VNC, VNC to the machine, get the ID and password, and then close the VNC and tunnel and connect with Teamviewer.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Dropbox and it’s (currently) unintuitive way of syncing folders outside of the Dropbox folder.

i didnt even know you could do that. i just drop everything in

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

OH. iTunes for Linux. Other than After Effects, that’s the only reason I have to boot into Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

iTunes and the way it syncs iPods requiring the use of 1 iPod per computer and one computer per iPod. Ridiculous.

If you were to write a program to treat the ipod like a disk drive rather than this proprietary apple shit, it would get use.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Dropbox and it’s (currently) unintuitive way of syncing folders outside of the Dropbox folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

uTorrent orders files in a torrent in a way I don’t like. When you have a torrent that contains several episodes named ‘Episode #’, episode 10 will follow episode 1 instead of episode 9 because for some reason it mistakes ‘10’ for ‘1.0’.

But what is your goal with this thread? Are you just surveying, or do you plan on actually fixing some bugs? I might have more annoyances, but I usually forget about them until I run into them again.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

xchat uses gtk which has linux style select<->middle mouse wheel control and paste, which works well under linux(because it’s used by the system) but it just fucks everything up on windows

happy now bitch

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Grooveshark (http://www.grooveshark.com/)
I like it, but a lot of songs don’t work (I know they can be flagged, but I haven’t seen any response from this).

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Actually I used xchat for quite a while but recently switched to pidgin.
The main gripes I had with xchat was that if you highlight something it automatically copies to clipboard, which is so unbelievably annoying. I had another problem with it but i forgot it.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:3, topic:376514”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=472437.msg3455804#msg3455804 date=1294021412]
Really I don’t have any complaints about it
[/quote]
Why the fuck did you post it then?

I have no problem with most of the applications I run (and they all have some sort of scripting language so I can usually build my own solutions). If I had to try and find a program I use a lot and had a problem with, it’d probably be Thunderbird and it’s newest big layout change. I don’t like it anymore lol.[/quote]
I was actually looking for a downside atm, and was just going to edit my post -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Explisionist:

Really I don’t have any complaints about it

Why the fuck did you post it then?

I have no problem with most of the applications I run (and they all have some sort of scripting language so I can usually build my own solutions). If I had to try and find a program I use a lot and had a problem with, it’d probably be Thunderbird and it’s newest big layout change. I don’t like it anymore lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Market Research 2011
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

Xchat. Really I don’t have any complaints about it, its pretty nice and the CPU is pretty low allowing to do more on my shit computer than what I use to be able to do having an application running.
You can’t minimize to the tray.

Read full topic
